title: The Wall Street Journal: TrumpStore.com expands sales-tax collections to 4 states
text:
45 a.m. ET Share
White House has pushed online retailers to pay more taxes Reuters President Donald Trump has slammed Amazon.com Inc. over how much it pays in taxes to state and local governments.
By Ruth Simon
The Trump Organization’s online store has started collecting sales taxes on orders shipped to New York and Virginia, doubling the number of states where purchases are subject to the tax.
The Wall Street Journal reported in early April that the e-commerce site, which sells polo shirts, baseball caps and other Trump-branded merchandise, collected sales tax only on orders shipped to Florida and Louisiana.
In addition to the website, the Trump Organization operates a retail store in New York City’s Trump Tower and a winery in Charlottesville, Va. States require a business with a physical presence in a state to collect sales tax on online purchases delivered in those states.
A Trump Organization spokeswoman didn’t immediately respond to a request for comment. She previously said, “Trumpstore.com has always, and will continue to collect, report, and remit sales taxes in jurisdictions where it has an obligation to do so.” The Trump administration has been pushing for online retailers to pay more in state and local taxes.
